column4: how do i make a symlink from "computer 1" to "computer 2" over a network using "sshfs"?
you'd need to mount the sshfs
i think that you might be one or two steps ahead of me.  i have an an "sftp" connection from my current computer to "computer 2" that appears to be mounted.
then copy the data to the mount point and it will copy to the server
i want to do this via the terminal and i want to make symlinks
then you can make a symlink to the mountpoint (or a subfolder within) to wherever you want
I am not sure where the sftp is mounted in my filesystem.  unfortunately i used the gui "connect to server" option that is standard with ubuntu.
found it in ~/.gvfs
you can add an entry in /etc/fstab
you may need to add:   mount -a    in /etc/rc.local  as the fstab file is processed before the network comes up
thanks for the advice.  the last bit about mounting is over my head though.
have a  look online, you'll find example lines you can tweak and add
I'd ask in #apple
thanks
check the license too :)
what do you mean check the license?
the mac license may not allow virtualizing the OS
you still need to satisfy the license
add it in /etc/rc.local
thats assuming it needs running before x runs
is there a good source/book/website that details the ubuntu/linux file system along with functionality and purpose.
